title.rendered: VT Markets Engages in Exclusive Monaco E-Prix Events

content.rendered:
VT Markets successfully hosted a series of exclusive events in Monaco, coinciding with the 2024 Monaco E-Prix. These gatherings provided a sophisticated and exclusive environment for a select group of VIP guests, partners, and media representatives.

The multi-asset brokerage firm, an official team partner of Maserati MSG Racing, initiated the media event on April 26th. The event featured appearances by Maserati MSG Racing drivers Maximilian Günther and Jehan Daruvala, along with Ludovic Moncla, Head of Affiliates at VT Markets, and Scott Swid, Chairman and Principal Owner of Maserati MSG Racing.

Building Partnerships and Enhancing Experiences

“The Monaco E-Prix stands as a significant event on the Formula E calendar, providing a unique opportunity to enhance our partnerships,” stated Scott Swid. “Our association with VT Markets extends beyond mere sponsorship, playing a pivotal role in our ongoing strategic developments and fostering a deeper connection with our partners.”

Ludovic Moncla added:”Our collaboration with Maserati MSG Racing transcends traditional trading, allowing us to engage with a global audience and offer them unique experiences.”

During the events, attendees enjoyed exclusive merchandise, such as signed caps by the drivers, and had the opportunity to see the Season 10 Gen3 Maserati Tipo Folgore up close. The events also included a luxury catamaran trip along the Monaco coast, aimed at fostering networking among the guests.

On the day of the race, VT Markets’ guests supported Maserati MSG Racing from prominent viewing spots, including La Rascasse and the grandstands. Despite some hurdles, the team achieved a ninth-place finish, contributing two points to their season score.

Commitment to Sustainability and Social Responsibility

VT Markets is committed to enhancing its corporate social responsibility efforts. The brokerage has implemented several initiatives as part of its ESG strategy over the past year.

In a notable effort, VT Markets facilitated the donation of 2,000 meals through the United Nations’ ShareTheMeal program from November to December 2023, addressing hunger and improving global welfare.

Additionally, during the holiday season, the company donated 1,240 educational toys to Cotlands in Johannesburg, supporting early development for underprivileged children.

Furthermore, VT Markets sponsored UNESCO’s 3rd International Workshop and Training on Youth and Young Professionals in Science, Engineering, Technology, and Innovation for Disaster and Climate Resilience. Martin Li, the Director of Global Marketing at VT Markets, delivered a keynote speech emphasizing the importance of equal opportunities for young STEM professionals.
